intro: Causonis timoriensis var. timoriensis, commonly known as the Timor caustic vine, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are often followed by follicles containing seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical environments, typically in moist, shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
